intro: Rhynchosia bolusii, commonly known as the Bolus's cowpea, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its typical pod fruits and nitrogen-fixing ability. The plant has compound leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets and produces yellow to orange flowers. Its seeds are enclosed in elongated pods and are often used in traditional medicine and as a food source. Rhynchosia bolusii is adapted to arid environments and is sometimes cultivated for its nutritional value.
